prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would. How many positive integers less than 1000 are congruent to 6 (mod 11)?
solution:
The least positive integer which is congruent to 6 (mod 11) is 6. The other positive integers which are congruent to 6 (mod 11) are $6+11$, $6+22$, $6+33$, and so on. We seek the maximum positive integer $k$ for which $6+11k<1000$. This maximal $k$ is the greatest integer less than $\frac{1000-6}{11}$, which is 90. So the set of positive integers less than 1000 which are congruent to 6 (mod 11) is  $$
\{11(0)+6, 11(1)+6, 11(2)+6, \ldots, 11(90)+6\},
$$and there are $\boxed{91}$ elements in this set (since there are 91 elements in the set $\{0,1,2,\ldots,90\}$).
solution_prompt:
Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following equal to 91?: To find out how many positive numbers are less than 1000 and have a remainder of 6 when divided by 11, we can start by listing out the numbers that have a remainder of 6 when divided by 11.

6, 17, 28, 39, 50, 61, 72, 83, 94, 105, 116, 127, 138, 149, 160, 171, 182, 193, 204, 215, 226, 237, 248, 259, 270, 281, 292, 303, 314, 325, 336, 347, 358, 369, 380, 391, 402, 413, 424, 435, 446, 457, 468, 479, 490, 501, 512, 523, 534, 545, 556, 567, 578, 589, 600, 611, 622, 633, 644, 655, 666, 677, 688, 699, 710, 721, 732, 743, 754, 765, 776, 787, 798, 809, 820, 831, 842, 853, 864, 875, 886, 897, 908, 919, 930, 941, 952, 963, 974, 985, 996

To count them, we can see that there are 91 numbers with a remainder of 6 when divided by 11. So, the answer is 91.
